alert.note: Alert for Lackawanna; Susquehanna; Wayne (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 30 at 4:35AM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central New York and northeast Pennsylvania, including the following counties, in central New York, Delaware and Sullivan. In northeast Pennsylvania, Lackawanna, Susquehanna and Wayne. * WHEN...Until 800 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 434 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen with up to another inch possible. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Carbondale, Archbald, Dickson City, Callicoon, Forest City, Mayfield, Clarks Green, Waymart, Dalton, Hancock, Jeffersonville, Union Dale, Prompton, Bethany, Starrucca, Equinunk, Rutledgedale, Stalker and Starlight. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
